description: Certainly light, but also deliciously fruity, with raspberries a dominant flavor in the juicy acidity and the softest, velvet tannins. Drink now.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2007 Bourgogne Pinot Noir  (Burgundy)

description: A solidly structured rosé with a bit of weight and great ripeness in the mouth. Strawberry and somewhat medicinal cherry fill the bouquet and palate, with a touch of herbaceousness on the finish.
title: Gayda 2008 Rosé (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: Wild berries, white cherry and even a touch of green olive or caper come to the forefront of this delicately colored rosé from Sicily. The wine loses momentum in the mouth, however, because of its bitter, slightly astringent feel.
title: Avide 2008 Herea Frappato Rosato Rosé (Sicilia)

description: A simple but easy-to-drink Chardonnay with soft aromas and flavors of ripe red apple and pear. Medium weight with a solid, clean finish.
title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Bistro Chardonnay (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This sweet, frizzy wine opens with a dark ruby color and offers a veritable aromatic explosion. You get it all here: from blueberry and raspberry to sweet spice and cinnamon cream. From the Casorzo region of Piedmont, the wine is fresh and intensely fragrant. Pair it with cold cuts and salumi.
title: Ricossa 2009 Antica Casa Red (Casorzo)

description: Earthy, rooty aromas get it started. The palate is lean and crisp, and the flavors are of sweet ‘n sour raspberry. A punch of cranberry shows itself on the finish, which is lean like the rest of the wine.
title: Santa Carolina 2008 Reserva Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Soft and broad, a little unfocused, the fruit showing pear juice and green apple skins. It feels light, juicy, missing concentration, and there's a caramel toast aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2008 Buissonnier Côte Chalonnaise Chardonnay  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: The aromas are not that inviting: roasted tomato, bramble, burnt earth, etc. The mouth is textured and solid, with savory, herbal berry flavors. Grabby and full on the finish, with a reduced, weighty overall persona. Strained but still pretty good for the money.
title: La Playa 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)

description: A bit unbalanced, with some raisiny tastes side by side with green, unripe notes of mint. But it's dry and smooth and rich enough, at this price.
title: Little Black Dress 2008 Merlot (California)

description: A brisk, brusque, tannic wine whose rusticity calls for easy fare, like backyard barbecue or even fast-food burgers. It's dry and full-bodied, a country-style blend with deep flavors of blackberries and tobacco. The price is fair.
title: Parducci 2006 Sustainable White Red (Mendocino County)

description: Though there's no oak on this Chard, it's still quite rich and ripe with loads of honeydew, yellow peach slices, lightly baked apple and tangerine oil. The mouth is round and lacking a bit more acidity, but as a whole the wine is enjoyable and easy to drink.
title: Penguin Bay 2008 Surfside Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: A curiously textured wine, with dry stone fruit characters, missing some of the aromatic virtues of Riesling. That said, it has good freshness, white currant acidity and a light, crisp finish. Screwcap.
title: Pratsch 2008 Select Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: The fruit is plenty ripe, offering rich flavors of blackberries and black currants, and the finish is thoroughly dry. The drawback with this Cab is its texture. It's rough and angular, suggesting unevenly ripe stems and seeds. Drink now.
title: R & B Cellars 2005 Reserve Bingham Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Starts off fine, with rich blackberry and black currant aromas and flavors. But once you take a sip, the wine turns sharp and unbalanced. Still, it's a perfectly decent sipper for everyday fare.
title: Shenanigans 2007 Fine Irish Cab Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Open, soft, creamy, along with a candied fruit character. There is freshness here, with the acidity dominant on the finish.
title: Signé Vigneron 2008  Mâcon-Villages

description: Not a bad wine but definitely overoaked for what it is. The nose bleeds resin and faux milk chocolate, while the chunky, herbal palate offers pretty good mouthfeel but also roasted berry flavors. Menthol and herbal notes rise up on the hot finish.
title: Simone 2008 Special Reserve Carmenère (Maule Valley)

description: Tropical fruit and new wood flavors thread this opulent, seductive Chardonnay. It has surface glamor, with its flavors of ripe mango, peach and toast. Under the surface, the flavors are simple, softly textured.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2010  Bourgogne

description: Warm, ripe and round, this red-fruited wine has a fine feeling of richness. It is soft and fruity, with just the right amount of acidity to balance. Ready to drink.
title: Manuel Olivier 2009  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Ripe flavors of orange and tropical fruit jam abound, with a buttered toast richness from the oak. Its appeal is all upfront, with a simple, popular sweetness.
title: 16X20 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dusty and warm up front, this has baked apple and peachy aromas. It feels round with only mild acidity, while the flavors yield barrel resin, citrus and sweet melon. It's not too evolved on the finish.
title: Tilia 2011 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Easy and cheerful, this has bright acidity and simple berry aromas. There's a hint of forest floor and a touch of bitter almond on the finish.
title: Vigneti Villabella 2011 I Roccoli  (Valpolicella Classico)

description: Here's a bright Pinotage that offers aromas of blackberry and plum, as well as faint hints of dried herb and cured meat. The palate is light and easy drinking, with approachable tannins and a short but clean finish.
title: Winery of Good Hope 2011 Bush Vine Pinotage (Stellenbosch)

description: This is redolent of red cherry, spice, leather and dried apple skin, with a sharp touch of medicinal herb on the finish.
title: Zanoni 2008  Valpolicella Superiore

description: Alluring aromas of tobacco, forest floor, smoking incense and chocolate are well defined. Supportive tannins frame its soft core, while conspicuous acids ramp up the earthy flavors. It finishes long, with a lingering note of dark stone fruit.
title: Mount Pleasant Winery 2008 Bethlehem Valley Norton (Missouri)

description: Notes of sweet pipe tobacco, dark fruit liqueur, mint-chocolate and raisin mingle on the medium-intense, ripe-smelling nose. Medium in body, this has a texture defined by its salient acids rather than its tannins, creating a bright feel. The light tannins add a dusty quality to the finish, concluding with hints of raspberry coulis and cherry.
title: D.H. Lescombes 2009 Pinot Noir (New Mexico)

description: This starts with some Verdejo sweat and funk on the nose, and while those notes don't last, the bouquet doesn't improve dramatically with airing. It feels soft and basic, with melon and lettuce flavors. Falls off a bit on the finish, which tastes a bit briney.
title: Naia 2010 Ducado de Altan Verdejo (Rueda)

description: A solid if standard Cabernet, this show typical varietal flavors of blackberries, black currants and anise, with the requisite jacket of toasty oak. Dry and full bodied, there's some bitterness on the finish that suggests its limited ageability. Drink now.
title: Napa Wine Co. 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Intense acidity precedes the ripe yellow fruits of this bright wine. It has a rich texture that's very minerally and steely, pairing with a vanilla note from its wood aging. It's a wine to be consumed young, over the next 2–3 years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2010 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This tastes sweet and clean, with mango, peach and orange flavors that are brightened with zesty acidity.
title: Ruby Red 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)

description: Easy and uncomplicated, this is dry, light-bodied and fine in acidity, with flavors of sour cherry candy, cola and smoky oak.
title: Sebastiani 2010 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: There are lots of rich, ripe vanilla, buttered toast and tropical fruit flavors in this creamy wine. Brightened with acidity, it will appeal to plenty of Chardonnay fans.
title: Steelhead Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: With some veggie and green, stemmy notes alongside tones of cherry and cola, this doesn't taste fully ripe. It's a very dry wine, with brisk acidity. Drink now, as it's unlikely to develop with age.
title: Armida 2010 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This opens with a blast of berry fruit and a note of spice. It feels bouncy, full and healthy, with black fruits and dark spices comprising the flavor profile. The finish is short, but fruity and clean.
title: Viña Albali 2011 Tempranillo (Valdepeñas)

description: Initial tar and asphalt aromas yield to grapy berry and earth notes. It feels hard but not real deep, with a short wild-berry flavor that leads to a reasonably good but superficial finish. Juicy and fresh.
title: Callia 2011 Alta Shiraz (Tulum Valley)

description: Aromas of sweet white peach and apple blossoms are lovely on this lean, light-footed Grüner Veltiner. The palate could use a hint more concentration, but it's lemony and brisk, with pleasant crushed chalk and grass notes. Drink now.
title: Lamoreaux Landing 2011 Estate Bottled Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)

description: This pure Cabernet Sauvignon is light and lean in appearance, with a slightly sour note on the finish. It offers easy aromas of ripe fruit, spice, black pepper and dried herb.
title: Fabiano 2009 Argillaia Intenso Cabernet Sauvignon (Veneto)

description: The bouquet bursts with ripe black-fruit aromas, alongside hints of crushed violet petals. The mouthfeel is round and filling, with a chocolaty flavor that stays through to the finish.
title: False Bay 2011 Pinotage (Western Cape)

description: A very sweet wine, this is just the thing most Muscat lovers will love. It's delicious in orange jam, tropical fruit and vanilla bean flavors. The acidity surfaces just in time, preventing the sweetness from seeming cloying.
title: Herzog 2011 Late Harvest Orange Muscat (California)

description: This is so softly sweet and delicious in mocha, wild berry, buttery nougat and spice flavors, it's like a candy bar with alcohol. Easy to drink, with a gentle mouthfeel.
title: Balletto 2007 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: This is easy to drink, with crisp, mouthwatering acidity that brightens the lemon, lime and tropical fruit flavors. It's slightly sweet, but not overtly so—just enough to pair with Asian-inspired fare.
title: Butterfly Kiss 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is a very pale Pinot Noir—you can almost read through it. It's also light and simple in texture, with some polished flavors of raspberries, Dr. Pepper and spices. It finishes dry and crisp in acidity.
title: Chessman 2011 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

description: While the texture is rich and full-bodied, there is an edge of sharp acidity that takes away from the generous ripeness. Tannins and juicy red fruits are present, but the acidity is a little jarring.
title: Domaine Guy & Yvan Dufouleur 2009 Clos du Chapitre Premier Cru  (Fixin)

description: Light and almost herbaceous, this is the simplest Chablis in the Laroche portfolio. It has pure, clean white-fruit and red apple flavors, tautened by acidity, ending with a crisp, green finish. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2011  Petit Chablis

description: While this is crisp and fresh, it also has an attractive, round vanilla flavor that provides a smooth, creamy texture. It's refreshing with apple and pear flavors, with appealing acidity on the finish.
title: Domaine Patrick Javillier 2010 Cuvée des Forges  (Bourgogne)

description: Scents of cherry and raspberry sauce unfold on the bouquet, while the approachable palate offers similarly intense, fleshy fruit flavors that are laced with hints of pepper and soft mint.
title: Neil Ellis 2010 Sincerely Shiraz (Western Cape)

description: Golden in color, this has bready baked-apple aromas. It feels plump and soft for a brut nature, with a maderized quality to the palate. It tastes extremely dry, like seltzer water blended with citrus, almond and butterscotch. It continues on the same flavor plane throughout the finish.
title: Jaume Serra 2007 Cristalino Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: This structured wine opens with aromas of subtle oak, toast, leather, espresso and dried plum. The extracted palate delivers prune, crushed black cherry, soy sauce and grilled herbs framed by bracing tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Begali 2009 Monte Ca' Bianca  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Tempting fruit and spice aromas come up with the finely textured bubbles. The flavors are layered, intricate and rich, suggesting red cherries, crisp apples, cinnamon and more. A light salmon color makes this look like a rosé but it's not labeled as such. It's generous, complex and delicious.
title: Breathless NV Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This delicately colored rosé is made by adding red wine to Chardonnay, allowed in the Champagne region, and hence the name Rosé des Blancs. It's a new venture for Gimonnet, under the current direction of Didier Gimonnet, and is a great success. Fruity, crisp and steely. it is light and bright; a fine apéritif style.
designation: Rosé des Blancs Premier Cru Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils NV Rosé des Blancs Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: A complex wine that takes time to unveil itself, this offers muted dark cherry and exotic cardamom spice, light and layered through the midpalate before revealing a taste of toasty oak on the finish.
title: Saintsbury 2012 Lee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This smells like a cherry crumble pie that's been heavily hit with cinnamon and other brown spices and served on slate. It dances across the palate with hearty spice, very vibrant fruit, cola and acidity that carries from beginning to end.
title: San Simeon 2012 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: A companion to the Helen's designate, this shows the same black cherry core, here with a streak of iron ore down the middle. Flavorful and rather fruity, its moderate acidity carries a hint of lemon.
title: Stoller 2011 Nancy's Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This dark-colored rosé comes from a single vineyard in the village of Dizy. It is certainly dry as its Extra Brut description indicates, but it offers so much ripe red fruitiness that it is also rich and concentrated. There is bright acidity at the end. Drink now.
designation: Dizy Terres Rouges Extra Brut Rosé
title: Jacquesson et Fils 2008 Dizy Terres Rouges Extra Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Fresh and crisp, this is bright with acidity as well as warmer fruitiness. It brings out the dry Laurent-Perrier style, balanced by soft creamed apples and fragrant acidity. Light and fruity at the end, it is ready to drink.
title: Laurent-Perrier NV LP Brut  (Champagne)

description: Jammy aromas of plum and berry are oaky and come with a hint of rubber and/or latex. This is weighty yet balanced. Earthy flavors of baked black fruits, tea and spice are slightly minerally, while the finish is oaky and generous, with a touch of menthol and heat.
title: Vinos de Arganza 2011 Flavium Selección Mencía (Bierzo)

description: The wine has all the right crispness and steeliness of a Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay. It also has warmth, yellow fruits along with a touch of apple. That makes a wine that is full-bodied while not missing out on a tight, very fresh aftertaste.
title: Tendil & Lombardi NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Testarossa's annual best-barrel offering starts with broad aromas of violets, blackberry tea and anise on the edges. It's a lighter Pinot density-wise, very soft and expressive with purple fruits, black olive and a fennel-powered acidify on the finish.
title: Testarossa 2012 Niclaire Pinot Noir (California)

description: Bold berry, leather and rubbery aromas show a minerally side. This is a big Malbec-driven blend with nice layering and structure. The flavor profile features reduced, roasted black-fruit flavors along with hints of herbs and leaf. The finish is generally smooth and long, with a pinch of heat. Drink through 2017.
title: Vistalba 2012 Corte C Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: From one of the Veneto's leading producers, this is made with native Turbiana grape. Creamy flavors of lemon pastry, Bartlett pear and yellow apple are brightened by refreshing acidity and a fine perlage. It finishes on an almond note.
title: Zenato 2012 Metodo Classico Brut  (Lugana)

description: Grapefruit, apple and walnut aromas lead the nose on this graceful blend of 80% Chardonnay and 20% Pinot Nero. The smooth, creamy palate offers pear, lemon zest and roasted almond alongside soft bubbles and fresh acidity. It boasts enough depth and complexity to age for several years. Drink now through 2018.
title: Majolini 2006 Electo Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Concentrated, potent aromas of earthy blackberry and cassis bring notes of briar patch, prune and exotic spices. The palate is full and oaky but fresh, with flavors of berry, cassis, herb and wood grain. A heavy finish with overt oak and related spice is modern in style. Drink through 2017.
title: Abad Dom Bueno 2011 Mencía (Bierzo)

description: Dark-colored, this rich, full-bodied wine is flavored with dry molasses as well as raisins. Cut with acidity, it has a mature feel that is both ripe and, at the end, dry, with a fragrant aftertaste.
title: Barão de Vilar NV Maynard 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Firm and dry, this wine shows more than its 10 years of aging. It has acidity as much as fruit, along with strong wood-aged flavors that push the spirit forward. At the end, it is all about the acidity and old wood flavors.
title: Dalva NV 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Grape growers since the end of the 18th century, the Dautel and Cadot families are based in the Aube area of Champagne. The family began making their own Champagne in 1971; now Sylvain Dautel works the vineyard by hand and makes the wine for this small maison. Full-bodied, this has touches of toast from the five years bottle age. The rich fruit also allows plenty of tight acidity into the mix. Drink this mature, well-balanced wine now.
title: Dautel-Cadot NV Cuvée Prestige Brut  (Champagne)

description: With a great balance between fruit and acidity, this is just what a 10-Year-Old tawny should be. Ripe fruits are cut by acidity and given a shot of wood aging. Spice and old gold flavors lead to a delicious fresh aftertaste.
title: Delaforce NV His Eminence's Choice 10-Years-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: This fresh, pure value red cranks out raspberry and boysenberry aromas in front of a crisp, tight palate. Ripe, quick-hitting flavors of red-berry fruits and toasty smoke finish zesty, with a lasting note of pie cherry.
title: Encanto 2011 Roble Mencía (Bierzo)

description: From one of Trento's leading wineries, this salmon-colored wine made from Pinot Nero and Chardonnay opens with aromas of rose, red berry and a whiff of nut paste. The palate displays more Pinot Nero, with wild cherry, strawberry and graphite flavors alongside a vibrant perlage and brisk acidity.
title: Ferrari NV Rosé Sparkling (Trento)

description: The nose on this Fess Parker study of barrel age is dominated by Christmas trees and eucalyptus, with subtle red fruit in the background. The palate is woody too, with tart cranberry amidst camphor, burnt cedar and spicy forest herbs. A very intriguing bottle.
title: Fess Parker 2012 Older Barrels Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This fresh Amarone offers an inviting fragrance of perfumed berry and exotic spice. Notes of graphite, black pepper and clove give depth to the ripe plum and blackberry flavors. It's balanced with firm, chewy tannins. Drink through 2019.
title: Le Salette 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This reserva from a warm year smells like crushed rocks, clay, wood smoke and spiced berry fruits. The palate is rubbery and tannic but bold, while oaky, roasted flavors of spiced black fruits and toast finish lightly baked and chocolaty. Drink through 2018.
title: Martín Berdugo 2009 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)

description: While demure and mineral at first whiff, this revitalizing Riesling blossoms on the nose as it aerates, accumulating layers of citrus and floral aromas. Off-dry in style, it boasts ripe yellow-cherry flavor streaked with lime-juice acidity.
title: Maximin Grünhäuser 2012 Abtsberg Superior Riesling (Mosel)

description: A blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Nero, this begins with aromas of chamomile, honey and acacia. The lively palate offers ripe yellow apple, candied citrus and walnut alongside a persistent perlage and bright acidity.
title: Montenisa 2006 Contessa Maggi Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Underbrush, tobacco leaf and raisin aromas lead the way on this structured wine. The smooth palate delivers black plum, prune, black pepper and exotic spice alongside velvety tannins and surprising freshness for the vintage. It closes on a licorice note.
title: Montresor 2009 Capitel della Crosara  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This structured, mineral wine offers tight acidity and strikingly fresh fruits. It's full of wood, juicy apple skins and lime juice giving a fresh, taut character. Still young, it needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012 Chatenière Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Principally a Bordeaux-style blend, with some Oregon Zinfandel included, this is toasty and dark, a muscular wine offering strawberry preserves, cassis, cola and a swirl of smoke. Quite young and fruit-powered, it's got the concentration to develop further 2018–2020.
title: Sineann 2012 Abondante Red (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Cedar, coconut, tobacco and earthy berry aromas are typical of Rioja. This is juicy and zesty in the mouth, with bright acidity. Flavors of berry, vanilla and earth finish strong. This is an excellent but not overly complicated wine; drink through 2024.
title: Valdelacierva 2009 Alfar Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

description: A unique and individual style of Sherry, even among palo cortados. It's dark amber in color, with a pungent mix of aromas that include molasses, raw brown sugar, chocolate and campfire. Feels fresh on the tongue, with coffee, dark chocolate and core peach and citrus flavors.
title: González Byass NV Apostoles Palo Cortado Viejo Sherry (Jerez)

description: A ripe and forward style with upfront notes of pineapple, softly-grilled peach, juicy melon and a touch of spice. The mouthfeel is round and rich, but with enough acidic cut to keep the palate fresh and lively through the long finish. Flavors of sweet orange citrus and ripe green fig linger endlessly.
title: Graham Beck 2009 Bowed Head Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

description: Light in color, with pecan pie aromas. There's nothing heavy or blowsy about this refined palo cortado; it's tight in the mouth, with narrowing acidity and tangy, oily flavors of citrus, almond and rancio. Long as they come on the finish, with zero excess weight.
title: Hidalgo NV Marqués de Rodil Palo Cortado Sherry (Jerez)

description: A sweet nose of oak spice, almond marzipan and cherry cola makes for a nice first impression. It boasts loads of balsam intensity with cola, ginger and black licorice. It's ripe, chewy and covers the palate while delivering tight structure on the long finish.
title: Le Gode 2006 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Hard and crusty on first impression, with smoky, leathery, meaty aromas along with hints of wild herbs and dark berry fruit. Feels racy and ultraslick, with cherry, plum and mineral flavors. Hits all the right notes while not pushing any buttons too hard or too often; long on the finish. Drink now through 2014.
title: Marco Abella 2006 Clos Abella Red (Priorat)

description: After it oozes rubber and bacon on the nose, berry fruit and mild medicinal aromas settle in. Feels full, tight and structured, with meat, black cherry and wild berry flavors. Finishes warm, chocolaty and lightly roasted. Well-made, and impressive for the price.
title: Martín Berdugo 2008 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A dark, garnet-colored appearance with brooding, masculine tones of spice, ripe fruit, dark cherry, as well as beautiful balsam notes of cola, dried mint and ginger. Balanced, not overdone. Let the tannins soften with age.
title: Podere La Vigna 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: For $20, this bargain basement Tokaji is pretty unbelievable. Abundantly floral and honeyed on the nose, it's deeply concentrated on the palate, with layers of luscious figs and peaches, accented by lanolin and beeswax. Creamy and unctuous on the tongue, yet clean and fresh on the finish, with orange-inflected acidity that lingers.
title: Royal Tokaji 2009 Mád Cuvée Late Harvest  (Tokaji)

description: Cabernet simply doesn't get richer or riper than this. It's a massive explosion of sweet cherry and blackberry jam, cassis, dark chocolate and caramelized oak, wrapped into firm tannins. Tastes like a candy bar now, nowhere near ready to drink. Hold until 2015, at least.
title: Rubissow 2008 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: If you think you don't like Merlot, try this one. It shows classic Napa Valley structure, with smooth, firm tannins and seductive flavors of sweet cherries, plums and currants. Delicious now with a good steak.
title: Rutherford Grove 2008 Estate Merlot (Rutherford)

description: Black licorice, cola and cherry liqueur open the nose and segue to black currant and crème de cassis aromas, then forest floor, bramble and Spanish cedar. This wine is linear, crisp and tight on the palate, with firm tannins. Give the wine five more years to soften.
title: Tenute Silvio Nardi 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Sweet new wood goes with rich plum skins in a wine that has a firm structure. The richness of the wine revolves around sweet cherries and juicy acidity. With the wood still dominant, it needs at least five years to settle down.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2009 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This is a GSM blend—about two-thirds Syrah—loaded with juicy acidity. The sappy, deep raspberry fruit sinks into the palate, racy and penetrating. It suggests that this is a wine to cellar for awhile. At the moment it suddenly hits a hard stop—a wall of slate and graphite.
title: Dusted Valley 2009 Wallywood Red G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This dark wine opens with bright fruit aromas that are soft and straightforward. The wine presents bold cherry, blackberry and spicy rum cake flavors, and a mouthfeel that is fresh and round. The finish is dominated by chewy berry fruit.
title: Fattoi 2006 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Licorice, ripe fruit, ginger, lemon zest, crushed stone, cassis and wild berry notes are bold, but in the mouth the wine is lean and compact, with a particularly bright and fresh feel in the mouth. There's even a menthol note at the very end.
title: Fattoria dei Barbi 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Here's a youthful expression of Sangiovese Grosso in which the grape's trademark acidity and fruity brightness shine through. Cherry, white almond, dried raspberry and rum cake notes present a soft, chewy feel in the mouth, although the overall structure is solid.
title: Fuligni 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: A dark, masculine, brooding Brunello, with savory aromas of leather and cured meat behind ripe fruit and blackberry. It's tight and clean, with a streamlined mouthfeel that testifies to the wine's firm tannic structure. Executed in a traditional style, it shows possibilities for long-term aging.
title: Altesino 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: An excellent value, the 2008 Gold Label Shiraz is a full-bodied, powerfully built wine, filled out by cassis, chocolate and tobacco flavors. It's long and velvety on the finish, not just an upfront powerhouse. Drink now–2020.
title: Wolf Blass 2008 Gold Label Shiraz (Barossa)

description: This Rosso boasts impressively intense and pure Sangiovese aromas. The wine is compackt, with red berry, rum cake, dried rosemary, ginger and spice. It's a small step away from the quality of Brunello at a fraction of the price.
title: Capanne Ricci 2010  Rosso di Montalcino

description: This ripe Grenache is full-bodied and fruit-driven, but seems to have the stuffing to last at least 3–4 years. Cherry-berry flavors are punched up by herb and spice shadings that linger on the finish.
title: Chapel Hill 2008 Bush Vine Grenache (McLaren Vale)

description: Warm spice and dark fruit tones with cured meat, bresaola, licorice, black pepper, leather and tobacco define this expression. The wine is plush rich, structured and firm.
title: Collelceto 2006 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: A solid wine, with plum skin and dry tannin textures. It does have the ripe fruit of 2009, attractive red fruits and juicy acidity. But it needs aging over at least three years to show its fruitiness.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2009  Pommard

description: Classic Brunello, albeit in a bold, dense style. Delicate, ethereal Sangiovese accents emerge, but the wine is also packed tight with modern aromas of spice, leather and dark chocolate. It shows nice balance and complexity. Textured tannins and tight structure keep it firmly in place.
title: La Collina dei Lecci 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The 2006 Pertimali tastes better than the 2006 Riserva and the 2007 Brunello. This wine is uniquely characterized by bold freshness and richness showing the clean and precise quality of Sangiovese fruit. The aftertaste is long, spicy and firm. Give this wine 5–10 more years.
title: Livio Sassetti 2006 Pertimali  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Spice, cherry liqueur, dark fruit, leather and moist tobacco comprise the bouquet. Structured and firm, the wine delivers a clean, focused feel.
title: Pecci Celestino 2007  Brunello di Montalcino

description: An intense wine, its spice finely integrated with a more fruity character. It has the classic Gewürztraminer lychee flavor but this is balanced with acidity, ripe baked apple and mineral structure.
title: Pierre Sparr 2010 Réserve Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Fermented and aged in stainless steel, this wine is all about fresh, vibrant fruit. Limes, Meyer lemons, gooseberries, Asian pears and something tropical, like papayas, all mingle together. Aging on the lees, which is a popular intervention in many unoaked white wines, gives additional notes of cream and sourdough.
title: Raymond 2010 Reserve Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Murky aromas of herbal black fruits and coffee grinds are funky. A scattered mouthfeel and herbal, spotty flavors of plum and currant finish briny. Overall, this is interesting and good but odd, with can't-miss herbal notes.
title: Finca Don Carlos 2013 Calathus Roble Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: Vines on the southern slopes of the Montagne de Reims have given this wine a soft character and ripe fruitiness. Fresh baked apples and bright acidity are right out front to produce a refreshing, accessible wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Autréau de Champillon NV Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)

description: This opens with aromas of pineapple, jasmine and wisteria. The palate offers tropical fruit, apple and citrus notes alongside vibrant acidity and invigorating bubbles.
title: Case Bianche 2014 Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: There's plenty to like in this bright and spicy, all-Willamette Valley wine. Cherry fruit is lifted with highlights of hot pepper candy. A slightly smoky, slightly burnt character marks the finishing tannins.
title: Cloudline 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A very reliable and widely available bottle for daily drinking, this shows blackberry, clove and rust on the fairly dense nose. It's quite juicy on the palate as well, with raspberries and bramble as well as sour plum skins and bright acidity. There's a touch of steel in the background.
title: J. Lohr 2013 Falcon's Perch Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: This clonal study leans into a quite tropical area, blending aromas of honeysuckle and other white flowers with guava fruit. There is good energy on the palate, with a sour apple-cider character midway, dried pears throughout, stony minerality and a bitter aftertaste.
title: Lafond 2013 Lafond Vineyard Musqué Clone Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Leesy whiffs of cured ham and salami are common, and this folds in grassiness and stone-fruit aromas as well. Chunky and fairly citric on the palate, this tastes mostly of orange and tangerine, while mango and nectarine notes pop up on the finish.
title: Lusco 2014 Zios Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Heady floral scents of wisteria, jasmine and hawthorn lead the way. The bright, frothy palate doles out crisp green apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of lime alongside a foaming mousse.
title: Masottina NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Delicately scented, this vivacious sparkler offers aromas of wisteria, wild flowers and white tree fruit. The vibrant palate offers crisp green apple and pear alongside racy acidity and brisk bubbles.
title: Merotto NV Bareta Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Soft, ripe, earthy aromas of sweet stone fruits and melon turn a bit soapy as this breathes out. Foamy and overactive, this rosé is chunky on the palate, with flavors of nectarine and brown sugar that finish round and easy.
title: Mestres NV Reserva Especial Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: Jammy berry aromas are pleasant and only slightly rubbery. This baby Monastrell (with 15% Syrah) is fresh but choppy and gritty in feel. Pure plum and cherry flavors finish with a medicinal note and lasting acidity.
title: Monterebro 2014 Joven Red (Jumilla)

description: An earthy aroma, light apricot and lemon flavors and crisp, tangy texture add up to a lean, medium-bodied and refreshing wine made from Pinot Noir grapes.
title: Navarro 2014 Rosé (Anderson Valley)

description: Herbal and stemmy (100% whole-bunch fermented), this is a bit of an outlier in the world of Australian Pinot Noir. It's light to medium in weight, with gentle tannins and tart cherry fruit. Oak takes the form of mocha on the finish. My initial impression was “simple but appealing,” but upon reflection perhaps it just needs more time to show its stuff.
title: Punt Road 2013 Chemin Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: In an oxidative style, this is a wine that is smooth and full of ripe fruit tones. With black plum and berry flavors it has just enough of a tannic edge, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Earthy, herbal aromas of cherry and plum come with a funky note of wet dog fur. Hailing from a cool, wet vintage, this is showing shearing acidity and abrasiveness. Quick-hitting raspberry, plum and red-currant flavors end with edginess and snap. This is 40% each Cabernets Sauvignon and Franc, with 20% Monastrell.
title: Rafael Cambra 2013 Dos Red (Valencia)

description: Scratchy cherry and raspberry aromas are lightly herbal. This 50-50 blend of Cabernet Franc and Cab Sauvignon is tightly wound, with punchy acidity. Herbal raspberry and red-plum flavors finish dry and lightly oaked, with rawness and herbal notes.
title: Rafael Cambra 2013 El Bon Homme Red (Valencia)

description: Aromas of jasmine and white orchard fruit lead the nose on this straightforward sparkler. The bright palate offers crisp green apple, kiwi and white peach accompanied by a frothy mousse.
title: Raphael Dal Bo NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Aromas of dry herbs, plum and raspberry come with a medicinal note of Band-Aid. This feels chunky almost to the point of being lazy, while earthy, baked black-fruit flavors are slightly salty. This Bobal holds firm on the finish, which is meaty in texture but herbal and medicinal in flavor.
title: Sierra Norte 2013 Temperamento Bobal (Utiel-Requena)

description: Sec is less dry than Brut in Champagne doublespeak, and so this is a soft wine that brings out perfumed red fruits and attractive acidity without great crispness. That makes for an attractive apéritif style, with a ripe aftertaste.
title: Taittinger NV Nocturne Rosé Sec  (Champagne)

description: A fresh citrus core underlies rich fig and walnut flavors in this light-bodied but luxuriously textured blend of white Rhône grape varieties. Crisp and tangy elements nicely balance out the ripe and savory ones.
title: The Girls in the Vineyard 2013 The Field Blend White (Dunnigan Hills)

description: This richly colored, rich-tasting wine has a lively mousse and ripe strawberry flavors. The palate is all about fruitiness, smooth and with just a light tang of orange zest at the end.
title: Jean Laurent NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: This is a soft, rounded and immediately accessible wine. Ripe apple and crisp green-plum flavors are balanced with a softness from the dosage. Ready to drink, the wine is freshly fruity with a lively mousse and creamy aftertaste.
title: Georges Lacombe NV Grand Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)

description: Juicy and soft with just a touch of tannin, this is all about red cherry fruits. A rounded texture makes the wine ready to drink.
title: Trenel Fils 2014  Côte de Brouilly

description: Ripe and jammy, this is an immediately attractive wine. Warm crushed-strawberry flavors have enough tannin and acidity to keep freshness. This wine can be drunk now, although it will be better, with softer tannins, from 2016.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2014 Eté Indien  (Brouilly)

description: Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus blossom lead the nose on this rich sparkler. The round, rather sweet palate doles out banana, green apple, yellow peach and apricot alongside a foaming mousse. Less sweet than a dessert wine, it would pair nicely with vanilla ice cream or cream-filled pastries.
title: Zardetto 2014 Zeta Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: From the village of Lantignié, rosé from this 1,300-foot elevation vineyard is fresh and light-hearted. Full of ripe strawberry flavors, the wine also has great acidity, giving a direct and fruity wine that is ready to drink.
title: Château de Basty 2014 Lantignié Rosé (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Sunny aromas of golden pear, caramelized red apples and toasted oak arise on the nose of this bottling from a winery near Morgan Hill. Dried grapefruits, smoked green apples and a jasmine-extract character show on the ripe palate.
title: Clos La Chance 2013 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: With a light layer of tannin, this structured wine comes from the heart of the Beaujolais Villages area. It has black cherry and red-fruit flavors balanced by the right amount of acidity. Drink now. The Colonge family has been growing grapes in Beaujolais since 1789.
title: Domaine André Colonge 2014  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This is a ripe and juicy wine with fine tannins and a swathe of black currant and cherry fruits. It bursts from the glass, fruity and with bright acidity. It is classic, ready-to-drink Beaujolais.
title: Domaine de Colette 2014 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine, while so fresh and fruity, also has some weight behind it, giving ripe plum and black-cherry flavors. A tannic texture behind the wine balances with the final acidity.
title: Domaine du Vissoux 2014 Les Griottes  (Beaujolais)

description: Here's a sparkling rosé that sports a bright raspberry pink color with blue highlights and aromas of wild berries, ash and white stone. In fact, the mineral component defines this wine and helps create a tonic and tight mouthfeel. Saccharine blueberry flavors make a brief appearance on the end.
title: Giovello NV Rosé Dry Cuvée Sparkling (Italy)

description: Honey, bee's wax, scented candle, lavender and buttery popcorn make up the fragrant nose of this luminous classic method sparkler. This is a unique and uncommon wine with drying, bitter almond on the close.
title: Olivini 2005 Brut  (Lugana)

description: Thick in sandpapery tannins, this Petite Sirah shows very ripe, sweet flavors of blackberry jam, currants, chocolate, raisins and pepper. It's rustic now, and likely to remain so over a long lifespan.
title: Perry Creek 2006 Altitude 2401 Fair Play Farms Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

description: This is a soft, ripely sweet Zinfandel that will be nice to sip with barbecue or baked ham. It's rich in blackberry and cherry jam, mocha, anise and pepper flavors.
title: Perry Creek 2006 Altitude 2401 Fair Play Farms Zinfandel (El Dorado)

description: Hot and chocolaty, with briary flavors of blackberry jam, plum currants, mocha and pepper. Turns Porty and raisiny on the finish. The alcohol is 16.5%.
title: Perry Creek 2006 Cobra Zinfandel (El Dorado)

description: Made country-style, this Zin is dry, medium-bodied and crisply acidic, with simple flavors of mashed cherries, raspberries and coffee. Nice with Italian fare.
title: Pozo Valley 2005 Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)

description: A little green and entirely basic, but in this price range it's not disappointing. The nose offers oregano, tomato and plum all in a savory wrapping, while the palate is lively and plummy, with no huge faults. Juicy as far as feel goes, with a bouncy red fruit-meets-herbal personality.
title: Santa Ema 2006 Merlot (Cachapoal Valley)

description: An everyday Cabernet, with black currant and oak flavors that are wrapped into chunky tannins. Drink this dry wine now.
title: Solaire by Robert Mondavi 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: If this wine were drier it would be really good, because it's crisp in clean acidity, and has excellently ripe, rich flavors of peaches, butter-sautéed pineapples and vanilla. But it's sugary and a bit cloying on the finish.
title: Terre Rouge 2007 Roussanne (Sierra Foothills)

description: This Prosecco Brut does have a touch of wet cardboard that weighs down the wine's natural aromas of peach, citrus and honey. The appearance is bright and luminous and the wine tastes tonic and fresh in the mouth.
title: Toffoli NV Brut  (Prosecco di Conegliano e Valdobbiadene)

description: An earthy nose of cherry and spice, followed by flavors of tart cherry, cedar and violet, give this wine a distinctive character. It's balanced and easygoing—a great go-to red for game, turkey and beef.
title: Keuka Spring 2007 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: For six bucks you get a dry, rich, creamy Chardonnay with nice flavors of pineapples, pears, apples and smoky vanilla. This is a great price for a wine of this polished appeal.
title: Leaping Horse 2008 Chardonnay (California)

description: A fresh white currant-flavored wine, attractive with its acidity and fresh berry character. Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, it has a grassy element, but there is also good intensity of sweet flavors.
title: Barrière Frères 2007 Grand Bâteau  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Wilson's red wines tend to be simple and forward in sweet, sugary fruit, and so is this wine. It shows jammy or pie-filling flavors of raspberries, cherries and currants.
title: Wilson 2005 Ellie's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A thin but crisp finish characterizes this luminous Prosecco, which also offers measured aromas of stone fruit, honey and jasmine. Pair this wine with simple finger foods on a hot summer afternoon.
title: Zonin NV Prosecco (Italy)

description: This is very floral and fruity--almost to the point of being candied and artificial--with prominent flavors of cherries and bubble gum, yet finishing dry. A decent summertime quaff.
title: Domaine Houchart 2008 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Even among value-priced Cabs from Chile, this one isn't offering much. The nose is sharp and brambly, with a hint of stem that takes a while to loosen its grip. The palate is made up of bitter-tinged raspberry flavors and short, choppy tannins. Seems more short on substance than in the past.
title: Errazuriz 2006 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Tart and sweet, like cherry and black raspberry Lifesaver candy, this blend of Italian varieties is distinctly rustic.
title: Brutocao 2006 Quadriga Hopland Ranches Red (Mendocino)

description: The color here is very bright and pink and the aromas are broad and flat with raspberry, lavender and candle wax. This sparkler is thin and watery in texture but ends with bright freshness.
title: Le Vigne di Alice NV Osé Rosé Brut Sparkling (Veneto)

description: Powdery and sweet smelling, with an acidic palate propelling pedestrian green apple, lime and orange flavors. Fruity but not very refined, with a tenuous balance that indicates that it should be drunk as soon as possible.
title: Sundance 2008 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: This is a pink-colored rosé sparkler made from Brachetto grapes that offers fresh aromas of raspberry, white cherry and cranberry. The bubbly produces a foamy cap and soda like effervescence with very sweet raspberry candy flavors on the close. Serve chilled with chocolate chip cookies.
title: Martini & Rossi NV Rosé Brachetto (Piedmont)

description: Enticing aromas of crushed black cherry, mature plum, black pepper, blue flower and tilled earth lead the nose on this vibrant, full-bodied wine. Rich blackberry, clove, espresso and black pepper back up the palate alongside firm tannins. It ends on a licorice note. Drink 2016–2025.
title: Pieropan 2010  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: You can taste the craftsmanship in this beautiful wine. The color is a brilliant light copper, the aromas and flavors remind you that the wine is made from 75% Pinot Noir, with cherry and cinnamon notes delicately coming through. A hint of fresh baked bread comes out on the palate and stays on the finish. Very tasty, and elegant in style.
title: Schramsberg 2010 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: Orange rind and exotic spices lend a mysterious appeal to ripe, rich flavors of melon, mango and peach on this intoxicating, unctuous Riesling. It's sunny and sweet on the palate, but tart tangerine acidity makes it refreshingly thirst quenching.
title: Joh. Jos. Prüm 2012 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Complex and rich, this is full of tangy fruits, with a dense structure that brings out weight, minerality and a chewy core of zesty citrus. It very crisp and fruity at this stage and needs to develop its many other flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: There's a surprising element of power to this Pinot Noir. Intense in dark cherry cola, clove and nutmeg, it offers a pronounced finish of wintery cardamom and caramel. The body is medium weight and the tannins smooth and silky.
title: Lynmar 2012 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Tense and full-bodied, Summit is from all Calera clone vines that deliver seductive elegance and earthiness. Cranberry and red currant follow aromatics of herb, dark cherry and classic Russian River cola spice. All the flavors develop further in the glass.
title: Lynmar 2012 Quail Hill Vineyard Summit Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dense and rich, this shows structure as well as powerful fruits. It comes from a parcel of chalk soil at the southern end of Pouilly Fuissé. The wine is firm, concentrated, packed with yellow fruits as well as layers of acidity and toast structure. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Les Combettes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is an old-world-style Pinot Noir that many a Francophile will love. Adorned in spice, earth and herbs, it is light in color and texture, with a deft approach to oak. Dark cherry fruit abounds around a silky, sublime mouthfeel.
title: Buena Vista 2012 Ida's Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: With just the right amount of bottle aging, this almost bone-dry Champagne is tight, steely while also hinting at the beginnings of toastiness. It is also full of crisp apple, lemon and pink grapefruit fruitiness, well integrated into the taut texture. Drink now for freshness, age for even more toastiness.
title: Jacquesson et Fils NV Cuvée No 736 Brut  (Champagne)

description: This is a dense wine, with mint aromas and dark, brooding tannins. Black plum and berry fruits are both rich and tight, with a strong mineral texture. It brings out the hard soil of the Douro and also the heat in the valley. It does need to age, so drink from 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Domini Plus Red (Douro)

description: Ultra Brut, the original no-dosage Champagne, is the name and that's just how this bone-dry wine tastes. It's totally crisp, fruity, structured and fresh. Acidity from tight citrus combines with apples and pears to produce a wine that offers both fruitiness and dryness. Like many super-dry Champagnes, it will benefit from some bottle aging, so drink at least six months after purchase.
title: Laurent-Perrier NV Ultra Brut  (Champagne)

description: A full-bodied, well-polished and nicely oaky wine with a smooth and full texture. Flavors are ripe and fruity and laced with vanilla, maple and toasted bread nuances. Vibrant acidity pairs with firm tannins to keep it mouthwatering on the finish.
title: Walt 2012 Blue Jay Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Delicate floral notes mingle with smoke and struck flint on this gorgeously composed Riesling sparkling. The palate is delicately pétillant with soft, tiny bubbles that fill the mouth with layers of caramelized sugar, fresh pears, blossom and minerals. Striking acidity drives a long, umami-touched finish.
title: Peter Lauer NV Sekt Brut Riesling (Mosel)

description: Spécial Club is a grouping of growers who taste each other's wines and approve them for Club status. This is certainly an impressive wine, seamlessly moving from freshness to richness via a steely texture. It is still impressively young and fruity, a bright, crisp wine that will age for several more years. Drink from 2016.
designation: Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Pierre Gimonnet et Fils 2006 Spécial Club Premier Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Nero and made without dosage, this opens with a delicate but alluring fragrance of white flower, citrus, stone fruit and pastry notes. The smooth, silky palate delivers lemon zest, ripe red apple, candied ginger and a yeasty note of baked bread alongside a soft, persistent mousse.
title: Barone Pizzini 2008 Bagnadore Riserva Non Dosato Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Spicy, leathery, gritty notes share the nose with ripe black-fruit scents on this blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Malbec. At this stage, the palate feels narrow and pinched but not miserly. Flavors of spicy blackberry, briary plum and cassis finish with smooth yet strong tannins and a note of licorice. Drink 2015–2022.
title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2010 Nicolás Catena Zapata Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Dense and delicious, this opens with aromas of plum cake, tobacco, leather and blackberry. The rich palate delivers crushed black raspberry, mocha and chocolate alongside brooding tannins. Give it time to unwind and fully develop.
title: Cesari 2008 Il Bosco  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This savory Pinot Noir features aromas of blistered tomatoes, Italian herbs, Dr. Pepper and strawberries stewed with anise. Oregano and rosemary give herbal backbone to the pomegranate fruit flavors, all culminating in a very sanguine finish.
title: J. Lohr 2012 Fog's Reach Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: To celebrate the family's 150th anniversary (founded in 1864), the Milans have released two Champagnes, half fermented in wood the other half in tank. The result for this Blanc de Blancs is a full wine, with a future that will bring out richness as well as a tight, mineral structure with just a hint of toast.
designation: Duo 150 Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Jean Milan NV Duo 150 Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: An estate-grown Pinot Noir from the wilds of Freestone, this wine delivers in high acidity and perfumed aromatics that are highlighted by violet and sandalwood. The taste leans towards tart cherry and strawberry. Medium in weight, it's a structured wine, with just the right amount of heft and oak on the finish.
title: Joseph Phelps 2012 Pastorale Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This beautifully balanced wine has dryness compensated by the intense fruitiness, the crisp mineral texture and a creamy mousse character. It is ripe, full of both apple fruits and lime juice with a tight aftertaste that will soften in the next months.
designation: Les Meuniers de Clémence Vrigny Premier Cru Extra Brut
title: Lelarge-Pugeot NV Les Meuniers de Clémence Vrigny Premier Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: Sometimes a wine has such a distinct individual personality that it stands out from the crowd, and this focused Pinot fits that description. There is a light touch of sophisticated, subtly spicy French oak but a crystal-clear raspberry fruit character energizes the aromas and flavors. It is medium-to-full bodied, but not at all heavy. It's hard to imagine tiring of this.
title: Masút 2012 Block 6 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: With its mature orange, onion skin color, this is a soft, toasty wine. It is losing fruit and gaining a wide range of mature flavors while keeping tight acidity. The wine tastes drier than previous vintages, a crisp aftertaste allowing the texture to shine and the more mature elements to develop well. Drink now, although the wine will age longer.
designation: Extra Cuvée de Réserve Brut Rosé
title: Pol Roger 2006 Extra Cuvée de Réserve Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Just lightly wood aged, this ripe wine from the fine 2010 vintage is opulent and generous as well as firmly structured. Tropical fruits come through the toast and steely edge, broadening and giving the wine great richness and density. At the end, the wine brings out acidity and a tight texture that promises aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2010 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: From a newer planting of the Durell Vineyard called the Ranch House Block, this Pinot is rocking in deep, delicious baked strawberry and raspberry fruit, fruity, lush and spicy yet balanced and tempting. The texture is satisfyingly velvety and complete.
title: Dunstan 2011 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This proves that sparkling wine does not have to be bone-dry to be sophisticated. Although moderately sweet, it is complex in aroma, elegant in texture and balance, rich in flavor and long on the finish. An appealing fresh-bread aroma leads to rich poached-pear flavors. This will be great with an after-dinner cheese course.
title: Schramsberg 2010 Crémant Demi-Sec Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Good grip and detail highlight this vineyard designate. Smoke, pipe tobacco, a whiff of cigar and a spicy edge bringing in cinnamon and clove are all well-matched to the ripe, plush fruit. Length and complexity make this a standout.
title: Aubichon Cellars 2012 Vista Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A unique and rich nose of clove, beet juice, freshly turned earth and wet chalkboard lead this wine. It's soft and peppery on the palate at first, with raspberry fruit, strong spice and excellent acidity.
title: Sextant 2012 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Light and a bit cloudy in appearance, this wine begins with a nose of wet slate and raspberry. Next comes a flavor of cherry tomato sauce that's combined with stewed spices of clove, anise and dried orange peel. Layered, interesting and complex.
title: Tantara 2012 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Very ripe, this offers sweet cherry and cinnamon aromas, equally enticing red cherry flavors plus great balance and purity. Full-bodied, it has silky texture and a long finish. A sweet oak influence is evident.
title: Walt 2012 The Corners Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Named for the Servite convent in the town of Borba, this fresh, crisp and tangy wine is citric, with almond and apple overtones. It's young, fruity and made for immediate consumption.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Reduced on the nose, this wine has a nuttiness and a petrol-like quality that colors its otherwise thin dried plum flavor. Low in oak, it will pair well with traditional Italian fare.
title: Benessere 2014 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Sangiovese (St. Helena)

description: This sparkling wine from Touriga Nacional grapes is dry, not just with acidity but also its firm tannic structure. An acquired taste, perhaps, but great with fresh sardines or other oily fish. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Tinto Bruto Classico
title: Global Wines NV Encontro Q do E Tinto Bruto Classico Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This opens with aromas of resin and a whiff of dried flower that follow through to the lean palate along with hints of citrus and dried stone fruit. But it's cut short by extremely bitter sensations that recall walnut skin.
title: Cantina di Gambellara 2015 Monopolio  (Soave Classico)

description: Lightly spritzy, this tastes of crisp apple and finishes just off-dry. It's deliciously refreshing, bright and tangy. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: The 12 months of wood aging has left its mark on this wine, giving it a spicy burnt character. That makes it tough and unlikely to broaden out. It will likely remain dry and firm.
title: Château Armandière 2011 Diamant Rouge Malbec (Cahors)

description: Gritty rubbery aromas are low on fruit and suggestive of tire rubber. A choppy palate shows lean peppery spicy plum flavors, while this tastes herbal and slightly tomatoey on the finish, sort of like pizza.
designation: Cameleon Made With Organically Grown Grapes
title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Cameleon Made With Organically Grown Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)

description: This range of wines comes from different regions of the southwest. The white comes from Gascony and is typical local blend. It is crisp and fruity with a soft texture from the ripe Colombard. There is a light dancing character to this lively, fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Gouleyant Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This is one of several wines from this producer that are created to give lie to the tannic Malbec. This is soft, ripe and full of the young fruitiness that demands to be drunk now.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Les Comtes de Cahors Malbec (Cahors)

description: This wine balances swathes of ripe berry fruit with hints of tannin. It's fruity, full bodied and delicious to drink now. A great barbecue wine.
title: Global Wines 2014 Cal Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft and easy wine with black currant fruit and gentle tannins, this has just enough acidity and structure to hold it together. Spice adds interest on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A very pale, watery straw color, this is soft and low in intensity, with faint aromas and flavors of citrus pith and fresh grass. The palate is thin and light, followed by a short, brisk finish. Drink now.
title: Neil Ellis 2015 Sincerely Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: A soft mouthfeel and fresh golden delicious apple flavors make this light-bodied wine easy on the palate. It has crisp and clean flavors all the way through.
title: The Naked Grape NV Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Smoky, toasted oak aromas lead to strong char and butter flavors and a viscous texture that clings to the palate. Subtlety is not one of this wine's virtues, as its outsized flavors stand in stark relief.
title: Auspicion 2015 Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a crisp, lightly perfumed wine with attractive apple acidity and touches of grapefruit. The texture is soft, with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Blason de Bourgogne 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is an earthy blend of Touriga Nacional, Jaen and Trincadeira. Unencumbered by wood aromas, it's full of structured red berry fruit and balanced acidity and is ready to drink.
title: Boas Quintas 2014 Encosta da Vinha Red (Dão)

description: Made to be drunk young, this wine gives a burst of ripe red fruit. The tannins are soft and open, balanced with acidity. The aftertaste is smooth and generous. Drink now.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2015 Versátil Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: With its typical prickle on the tongue, this is a medium sweet wine. It's clean, crisp and citrusy, with sliced apple and orange zest flavors. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine's blend symbolizes the Tarn's halfway position between the Atlantic and the Mediterranean. So it is has the perfumed Syrah and the more structured local Braucol to give a bright fruity wine with some touches of tannin as well as red-berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Château Clément Termes 2016 Les Petits Clément Syrah Braucol Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)

description: According to legend, the Baron of Figuiera got his foot stuck in the stirrup while riding one day. He promised that where his horse stopped, he would build a chapel, and that's where this 2,100 foot high, cool-climate vineyard is today. The wine is crisp and fresh, with attractive citrus notes and plenty of refreshing acidity. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Barão de Figueira Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: A large production offering, this white is simple and direct in its expression of the variety, remaining steely and low in oak on the palate, with a depth of green apple and melon fruit.
title: Decoy 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This warm, ripe wine is open and ready to drink. With its bold red fruit and generous, well-integrated tannins, it's made for barbecues. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: A light orange pink color sets the scene for a fruity wine that has raspberry flavors, soft acidity and an attractive, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Pigmentum Malbec Rosé (Côtes du Lot)

description: This is a classic style of Bairrada sparkling wine—a blend of Bical, Maria Gomes and Arinto. Plenty of crisp acidity and soft white fruit flavors balance its yeasty character. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico
title: Global Wines NV Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Pristine Asian pear and lemon perfume on the nose of this full bodied Chardonnay take a slightly darker savory tone on the palate. The mouthfeel is rich and textured, but brambly slightly vegetal notes and a bite of astringency distract on the finish.
title: Heron Hill 2015 Unoaked Ingle Vineyard Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: A hint of maple syrup in the aromas and flavors gives this medium-bodied red a touch of sweetness. Oak flavors dominate the modest fruit on the palate.
title: Jack's House 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Port-like cedary aromas and mature flavors mark this full-bodied, ripe and broad-textured wine. It's tasty in a superripe way, although the high alcohol is apparent on the finish.
title: Longevity 2013 Petit Verdot (Lodi)

description: This wine starts out a bit reduced, along with aromas of melon and red apple. It drinks a hair off dry, with a blend of stone-fruit and tropical flavors.
title: Martinez & Martinez 2015 Tudor Hills Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

description: This wine veers slightly sweet, like many overripe red blends. It's deep in color, soft in and makes a good counterpoint to spicy foods.
title: Mirassou 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Dusty plum and berry aromas are clean. In the mouth, this is hard and wiry. Salty snappy plum flavors dry out and taste a bit like tin on a raw finish.
title: Proemio 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This is a floral, aromatic and dry rosé, full of red currant fruit and refreshing acidity. It's a great apéritif wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Rosé (Tejo)

description: This is a soft, gentle Pinot with a plum jelly flavor derived from a touch of sweetness in its fruit. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010 Bourricot Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Made to appeal to the modern taste for sweetness, this blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay and Viognier is simple in jammy apricot, citrus and tropical fruit flavors. It has bright acidity, which helps balance it.
title: LoveThisLife 2009 White (California)

description: There's a Porty overripeness all through this wine, like concentrated raisins and prunes. Although it's basically dry, it has a raisiny sweetness, especially toward the finish.
title: Drew 2010 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: This opens with standard cherry and berry aromas before transitioning to a juicy palate with red berry, plum, herb and grass notes. It finishes a little hot and aggressive, but for $4 who's complaining?
title: Terrenal 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yecla)

description: A touch of minerality on the nose comes with apple and lemon aromas. It feels fleshy, with pulpy white-fruit flavors that end with honeydew and papaya notes. Drink now.
title: Bodega Norton 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: This is a ruggedly simple blush wine, with lots of acidity and some green tea and dried herb flavors. It's saved by a just-in-time flavor of black cherry candy.
title: Curtis 2011 Heritage Rosé (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a lightweight, fruity and softly tannic wine. The red berry flavor is bright and breezy, and the acidity is a dominant feature. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: Fruity and off-dry, this has light touches of sweet strawberry and vanilla to go with the orange zest acidity. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Pink Elephant Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This has ripe blackberry and oak flavors. It's dry, full bodied and tannic enough to cut through a rich, ketchup-strewn cheeseburger.
title: Lost Angel 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: This seems sweet like a Port. It tastes like raspberry and cherry jam, with lots of heat from the alcohol.
title: Minassian-Young 2010 1000 Vines Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: There's an unripe, green edge to this Zinfandel that detracts from its appeal. Yet it has some good blackberry fruit, and it's nicely dry and tannic. Pair this with rich meats and cheeses to coax out the sweetness.
title: V. Sattui 2009 Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A simple Chardonnay, this seems sweet in pineapple and peach jam notes, with buttered toast and honey flavors from oak. Flashy, but one-dimensional.
title: Hess Collection 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: If you like tart, less-than-ripe Sauvignon Blanc, you'll enjoy this one. It's acidic, but relieved by lemon, lime and honey flavors.
title: White Oak 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe and fruity, this bears a red berry flavor and a dry structure. It has weight, richness and a smooth finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Azul Portugal Rosé (Setubal)

description: Crisp and herbaceous, this is a green-fruited wine that's light on the palate, offering delightful refreshing acidity. This is very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Clemens Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: The light prickle adds to the natural freshness of this lemon-sherbet-flavored wine. Very crisp and light in the mouth, this dances on the palate with just a touch of sweetness.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Salsus White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a ripe Chardonnay with aromas of pineapple, Golden Delicious apple and honey. It's slightly thick and sticky on the close.
title: Caldora Vini 2010 Chardonnay (Terre di Chieti)

description: Jumpy and nervy smelling, with tottering aromas of jammy berry and strawberry. It feels dilute at first, but more structure and body appear as the wine unfolds. The flavor of jammy raspberry is somewhat herbal, and the finish is light.
title: Convento Oreja 2010 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This is a vigorous Zinfandel, fruity and soft, with berry, cola and spice flavors. Drink now with barbecue, burgers or beef burritos.
title: Napa Cellars 2010 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: This 100% stainless-steel-aged Sauvignon Blanc has a crisp, herbal mouthfeel, with a melon-like brightness. Just a touch of green pepper and jalapeño muddle the finish.
title: Peltier 2011 Hybrid Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)

description: Although this Cabernet bears a Napa Valley designation, it could be from anywhere. It's rich in tannins and has good blackberry and herb flavors that finish a little pruny.
title: RouteStock 2009 Route 29 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Extracted and oaky, this will appeal to those who enjoy the popular style. It's strong in buttered toast and butterscotch flavors, with a pineapple jam note.
title: San Simeon 2009 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Modest orange and peach flavors are found in this oak-tinged wine. It offers the Chardonnay lover good pleasure.
title: Arrow Creek 2011 Coastal Series Chardonnay (California)

description: The nose of this blend of 58% Syrah, 17% Cabernet Franc, 9% Merlot, 8% Malbec and 8% Petite Sirah is a touch funky, with sour blackberry, charcoal and dried meat aromas. Charred blueberry, sour black plum and savory meat flavors show on the palate.
title: Hawk Watch Winery 2013 The Deep Six Red (South Coast)

description: The nose is a bit shy but eventually reveals underbrush, red berry and a toasted note. The straightforward palate is quite lean, offering raw sour cherry, a green note of powdered sage and a hint of ground pepper alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.
title: Il Grappolo 2012  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Muted aromas of tart gooseberry and lime peel dance in the bouquet, while pithy flavors of plum skin, currant and citrus rind unfold on the lightweight, slightly astringent palate. Pleasant hints of fresh herbs and saline make a fleeting impression on the close.
title: Waterkloof 2015 Circumstance Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: This mountain-grown wine is hugely tannic and oaky, hard to penetrate in its full-bodied ripeness. Smoky oak and currant flavors vie for attention against a backdrop of concentration and power.
title: Charles Krug 2013 Limited Release Cold Springs Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: This wine offers nice balance between the ripe-fruit tones of pear and green-apple and the green, stemmy herb and grass notes. There are subtle smoke and spice accents that unfold on the finish, following a plush mouthfeel that's enlivened by bright citrus tones. Drink now.
title: Fat Barrel 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: This fruit-driven white blend is powered by Roussanee, which showcases its hallmark pineapple fruit. Hints of honey and pear add a bit of nuance, but this easy-drinking, medium- to full-bodied wine remains pretty straightforward.
title: Château Saint-Nabor 2015 White (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Scents of green apple and plum lead the bouquet, with a strong lime-pith note that carries through to the palate. The texture is soft and somewhat flat on the midpalate, but ample acidity and a pleasant astringency help to lift the close. Drink now.
title: KWV 2015 Classic Collection Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Like the hyperexpensive Cuvée à Tempo, Pegau's 2015 Cuvée Reservée has a slightly bitter edge to the finish. Otherwise, it shows subtle pineapple, anise and white gumdrop notes and medium body.
title: Domaine du Pegau 2015 Cuvée Réservée White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Bright aromas of tart apple, melon rind and fresh chrysanthemum dance in the bouquet, while the lively, lightweight palate offers notes of white peach and citrus pith. A subtle astringency graces the close. Drink now.
title: Essay 2015 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This is a fresh and lively white, with some green bean and herbaceous notes to support the core of gooseberry and lime rind aromas and flavors. It's light and straightforward, but clean and so easy to enjoy. Drink now.
title: Graham Beck 2015 The Game Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

description: An aromatic opening of compost and vinegar might suggest casting this aside. But flavors of strawberry and chocolate, along with an admitted weedy note, amount to something decent. Finishing notes of brown sugar and berry syrup are chocolaty and ensure that this finishes better than it begins.
designation: Colección Vivanco Dulce de Invierno Late Harvest
title: Vivanco 2011 Colección Vivanco Dulce de Invierno Late Harvest Red (Rioja)

description: Produced in the west of Gascony, with a strong oceanic influence, this Chardonnay is cool, fruity and with bright acidity. It does have a creamy texture that fills out the fruitiness. It is an attractive, ripe wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de l'Herré 2015 La Galope Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This is a light wine with plenty of acidity and soft tannins that come together in a juicy, crisp, red fruit-flavored medley. Ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Oceanus Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)

description: An intriguing blend of grapes with both Bordeaux and Gaillac origins has produced a wine that has a softly herbal character as well as richer white stone fruits and an attractive perfume. It is a pretty wine, ready to drink and very fruity.
designation: Le Temps des Vendanges Sauvignon Blanc-Loin de l'Oeil
title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Le Temps des Vendanges Sauvignon Blanc-Loin de l'Oeil White

description: With hints of minerality typical of any wine from the Dão, this has tight, yeasty notes that contrast with its crisp, bright apple fruit. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Bruto Sparkling (Dão)

description: A wine for early drinking, this is soft, fruity and bright. With red berry flavor and gentle tannins, it's direct and packed with fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Pé Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This gentle blend of Aligoté and Chardonnay shows yellow fruit flavors. It has a crisp edge to its round smoothness. Drink now.
title: Pierre Gruber 2015  Coteaux Bourguignons

description: Gritty aromas suggest burnt popcorn and match stick. This is a round oily style of Torrontés with briny tropical fruit flavors. A salty note of persimmon carries an O.K. finish.
title: Solo Contigo 2016 Premium Series Torrontés (La Rioja)

description: This is a dry sparkling wine with tannins, spice and berry fruit, giving it a deep color. Not an apéritif wine, it's perfect for cutting through rich, oily foods. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Tinto Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: A blend of Chardonnay, Garganega and Sauvignon, this has aromas of peach and golden apple. The simple palate offers pineapple and banana alongside bright acidity. Enjoy soon.
title: Amatore 2015 Bianco White (Veronese)

description: While light in color, this wine is flavorful and easy to enjoy. Its smoothly textured, medium-bodied palate carries generous red cherry and plum flavors.
title: Rubino Estates Winery 2012 Saluté Red (Livermore Valley)

description: Blended with less than a handful of Petite Sirah, this wine is thick and ultraripe, showing dense chocolate and plum sauce flavors, accented with soy.
title: Mazzocco 2014 Sullivan Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A soft and ripe wine with spicy red fruit flavors cushioned by a smooth texture, this has well-embedded tannins and can be drunk young.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Named after the series of vineyard terraces that rise steeply from the Lot river, this wine is soft and easily accessible. It does have the Malbec structure although this is comfortably balanced by the black fruit and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Rigal 2014 Les Terrasses Malbec (Cahors)

description: From four estate vineyards, this wine appears to be low in oak and extra crisp in mouthfeel, offering austere apple and citrus elements with a slight metallic edge.
title: Thomas George 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Already a bit light in color and showing some rust at the rim, this medium-weight, silky-textured wine features aromas of sun-baked clay and cherries. There's not much depth or richness, but the tart fruit makes for an easy quaff. Drink now.
title: Les Vignobles Foncalieu 2014 Bastide de Beauvert Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Eight years down the line and this Malbec shows the flaws caused by a harvest marred by freezes. This smells like a mix of green bean and jammy boysenberry. The palate feels saturated but soupy, with outsize acidity. Green-herb flavors mix with baked plum and blueberry, while the finish feels sticky, tannic and heavy.
title: Antonio Gonzalez 2008 Don Antonio Grand Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This is a simple, tart red, crisp in cranberry and red currant fruit and perfumed with spicy oak. Despite the high acidity on the front palate, it hangs heavy in full-bodied ripeness.
title: Spann Vineyards 2012 Cross Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

description: Fresh grass, gooseberry, lime leaf and a touch of melon rind appear on the nose and mouth of this straightforward wine. It's lightweight and easygoing, with brisk acidity and a crisp, refreshing finish. Drink now.
title: Long Neck 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Aromas of mature yellow apple and a whiff of chamomile flower lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the extremely ripe palate along with a hint of acacia and a marked note of bitter almond.
title: Marcello Turra 2015  Soave

description: An overachiever among dessert wines. It opens with ripe melon and sweet stone fruit aromas, but it's not overly challenging or heavy. The palate is thick but offers just-right acidity, which frames sweet, enjoyable orange, lychee and honey flavors. Rich yet bright; an extreme.
title: Viña Tabalí 2010 Late Harvest Muscat (Limarí Valley)
